column4: is there any way to verify that my PCMCIA slot is functional short of installing win32 as a test???
KNOPPIX
any specific commands?
pop in a pcmcia card
i'm on ubuntu and it doesn't seem to be recognizing
uhm... what?
I'm running ubuntu.... I've put a card into my PCMCIA slot.... dmesg shows that it detects the card being inserted..... but i can't seem to pull up any information about the inserted card
perhaps its not a supported card?
perhaps you need a module loaded?
that's what I'm trying to determine..... i've inserted two different linksys cards, but i currently don't have anything else i could insert in order to test
Try finding the right module, if it exists
If the card isnt' recognized, then you can't pull up info on it
tried cardinfo?
what I'm trying to do is verify that the bus is functioning properly before I order a $70 PCMCIA wireless network adapter
Then it probably works
but then why can't I see either of the two different and functional cards in lspci?
what makes you think the bus is broken?
the fact that nothing shows up in lspci after inserting two different cards
did you install the driver/module for those cards?
Try a card that Linux supports
I can't without buying one... and I don't want to buy one if it turns out my bus is bad
Go to an electronics store (Radio Shack? Apple Store) and bring your laptop, plug in a card, and see if it sees it
